titleStmt.title: Chastities conquest, or, No trusting before marriage a new song, you virgins that your fame and honour prize, learn here by saving both, how to be wise, secure your treasure till you have secur'd, the purchaser and then you are insur'd a thing that forehand freeness ne'r procur'd.

notesStmt.note: "To the tune of, Canst thou not weave bone-lace."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
